name: Address
description: The AD data type specifies the address of a person or institution. It was retained for backward compatibility but has been largely replaced by XAD (Extended Address) as of HL7 v2.3. Supports both institutional and personal addresses with comprehensive geographic designations.

AD.1.name: Street Address
AD.1.description: Specifies the street or mailing address of a person or institution. When referencing an institution, this component is used to specify the institution name. When used for a person, this component specifies the first line of the address.

AD.2.name: Other Designation
AD.2.description: Specifies the second line of address. In general, it qualifies the address. Examples: Suite 555 or Fourth Floor. When referencing an institution, this component specifies the street address.

AD.3.name: City
AD.3.description: City, district, or place name component of the address.

AD.4.name: State or Province
AD.4.description: State or province component of the address. Use standard postal abbreviations where applicable.

AD.5.name: Zip or Postal Code
AD.5.description: ZIP code or postal code component of the address.

AD.6.name: Country
AD.6.description: Specifies the country where the addressee is located. HL7 specifies that the 3-character (alphabetic) form of ISO 3166 be used for the country code.

AD.7.name: Address Type
AD.7.description: Specifies the kind or type of address (e.g., home, business, mailing, etc.).

AD.8.name: Other Geographic Designation
AD.8.description: Specifies any other geographic designation that may be necessary. It includes county, bioregion, SMSA, etc.

constraints.backward: Retained for backward compatibility; XAD preferred for new implementations
constraints.geographic: Should follow standard postal address formats for the respective country

usage: Patient addresses in PID.11 - Patient Address
Next of kin addresses in NK1.4 - Address
Guarantor addresses in GT1.5 - Guarantor Address
Legacy address fields throughout HL7 messages

generationHints.typical: Use realistic addresses appropriate for healthcare demographics
generationHints.formats: Follow postal conventions for the target country
generationHints.institutional: For institutions, use organization name in AD.1 and street address in AD.2

replacement.note: The AD data type has been largely replaced by XAD (Extended Address) data type as of HL7 v2.3
replacement.migration: New implementations should use XAD for enhanced address support
replacement.compatibility: AD is maintained for backward compatibility with older systems
